title: the CESSpit
text:
We use thinking-boxes and lots of numbers to learn about the long-term stability of communities, and how they respond to stressors.
We work at the intersection of population and community ecology to help us understand how communities change and evolve. We approach these questions using a combination of data-driven analyses and simulations.
We have a specific interest in ecological networks, allometry, demography, and paleo communities.
Insert stance on open science (and other)

title: Join Us
text: I personally think its easier to treat this as a â€˜staticâ€™ page that gives an overview of joining the lab as opposed to listing actual â€˜job advertsâ€™ since those will need to then be kept up to date - i.e., someone will have to be responsible for that OR we need to create some vaguely RSS feed-like thingâ€¦

title: Join Us
text:
PhD
Looking for a PhD? We typically work through doctoral training programmes in the UK and posts are advertised Nov-Dec.
International students can apply at anytime. We are happy to help with applications for funding. Send your CV and ideas.
Weâ€™ve worked with students from Iraq, Kuwait, and Malaysia

title: Join Us
text:
Post Docs
If you are interested in joining the lab as a post doc, via fellowships or independent funding, get in touch with either Andrew or Dylan (email pending), including your CV and a letter describing your experience and interests.
Weâ€™ve hosted people from around the world including Chile, Sweden, Germany, and Australia
Positions linked to grants will be posted here too.

title: Join Us
text:
Short Visits
We welcome short visits, study leave and sabbatical visitors!
